reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Frame Agreement with NGO (Foundation for Human Rights/KIOS)

description.narrative: ESC rights training. The gender equality perspective has so far been relatively little concerned in the implementation and international monitoring of the ESC agreement, and women's active participation in the UN monitoring mechanisms except CEDAW is scarc e. All South Asian countries have ratified the ICESCR and the CEDAW. The project aims to strengthen the South Asian women human rights actors? knowledge and understanding of ESC rights in order to promote women's rights in the national and international le vel and to influence development of the paradigm of women's ESC rights, in particular the South Asian region. The objective is that the women who participate in the training program gain skills and tools so that they can apply the ESC rights frame in their work for the strengthening of the national implementation of the women? rights, and to approach the structural causes of the poverty, discrimination and inequality by human rights based perspective. Immediate target group of the project consists of 20 wo men and men human rights activists participating in the training program. The real beneficiaries are the marginalized community members, for whom rights to the organizations of persons involved in the training program the work for. PWESCR in India in 2005 to set up human rights organization that focuses on women's human rights , particularly economic, social and cultural rights.PWESCR is a human rights organization founded in India in 2005, which is focused on women's human rights, particularly economic, s ocial and cultural rights.
